title: Rubio Fleshes Out Trump’s Case That Iran Nuclear Capacity Was Eliminated
summary: Secretary of State Marco Rubio said U.S. strikes had destroyed a facility that is key to producing a nuclear weapon. He railed against a less optimistic U.S. intelligence report.

title: Iran’s Attack on a U.S. Base in Qatar Is a Nightmare Come True for Gulf States
summary: The countries have long worried about being sucked into regional war as they juggle relations with Washington, their security guarantor, while seeking to improve ties with Tehran.

title: Trump’s Name Could Adorn Tel Aviv Hotel, Becoming a Symbol or a Target
summary: The Trump Organization’s preliminary talks this spring about affixing its brand to a tower near a recent missile strike highlight the complexities of its international deal-making.

title: A New Political Star Emerges Out of a Fractured Democratic Party
summary: The emergence of Zohran Mamdani, a democratic socialist, is likely to divide national Democrats, who are already torn about what the party should stand for.

title: Inside the Global Deal-Making Behind Trump’s Mass Deportations
summary: The administration is pushing nations around the world, including ones at war, to take people expelled by the U.S. government who are not citizens of those countries.

title: Rep. LaMonica McIver Pleads Not Guilty to Assault at Migrant Detention Center
summary: Representative LaMonica McIver was caught up in an onrush outside a troubled Newark immigration facility where, weeks later, four detainees escaped.

title: NATO Agrees to Boost Military Spending as Trump Praises Allies, but Criticizes Spain
summary: President Trump has pressed allies to spend more on defense. Leaders agreed that “allies” — but not “all allies” — would meet the objective.

title: Trump Says He May Send Additional Patriot Systems to Ukraine
summary: The president met with President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine but neither the White House nor Mr. Zelensky offered any details about their encounter.

title: U.K. Says It’s Buying 12 Jets That Can Carry Nuclear Weapons
summary: The decision means that Britain’s air force will have a nuclear role for the first time since the end of the Cold War.

title: RFK Jr. Accuses Gavi, Global Vaccine Agency, of Ignoring Science
summary: Robert F. Kennedy Jr. claimed that the agency, Gavi, had “ignored the science” in immunizing children around the world.

title: RFK Jr.’s Handpicked Vaccine Advisers Are Set to Meet for the First Time
summary: The panel will revisit the hepatitis B shot given at birth, among others. The former head of an anti-vaccine group has been hired as a special employee at H.H.S.

title: Online and IRL, Trump Offers a Window Into His Psyche
summary: Other countries used to need spies to discern the thinking of American presidents. Now they just need a Truth Social account.

title: Inside a Last-Ditch Battle to Save (or Kill) Clean-Energy Tax Credits
summary: Supporters of tax breaks for wind and solar are fighting to retain them in the G.O.P. tax bill. They’re facing a conservative effort to kill them entirely.

title: Why Did the Novel-Reading Man Disappear?
summary: Men are leaving fiction reading behind. Some people want to change that.

title: Usha Vance’s New Life in Trump’s Washington
summary: Old friends are bewildered by the turn taken by the second lady, a onetime Democrat and former litigator for a San Francisco firm. Others say she’s happy in the role.

title: The Weapon That Terrorizes Ukrainians by Night
summary: How Russia’s terrifying long-range drone program has brought about a deadly new phase in the war.

title: In Alabama, a Social Media Influencer Really Gets Wild
summary: Kyle Lybarger built a loyal following online by talking about native plants and why biodiversity matters.

title: Video Shows Engine Sparks as Plane Returns to Las Vegas Airport Just After Takeoff
summary: The crew of an American Airlines flight from Las Vegas to Charlotte, N.C., reported an engine issue.

title: With Bezos Wedding, Venice Braces for Love in the Time of Tech Billionaires
summary: The celebration of Jeff Bezos and Lauren Sánchez has divided a city that centuries ago set the standard for opulence.

title: ICE Will See You Now
summary: It won’t be easy to get rid of authoritarian habits of mind.

title: Times Readers Open Up About the Real Cost of Motherhood
summary: What’s the real cost of motherhood? Here’s what our readers said.

title: A Primary and a Heat Wave
summary: We’re covering the upset in New York City and the weather.

title: Late Night Is Taken Aback by Trump’s Potty Mouth
summary: Seth Meyers said that even with “zero standards of expectations for Trump,” he was shocked to see the president use profanity on the White House lawn.

title: Extreme Heat Continues for Many on Wednesday, but Relief Is Near
summary: After days of record-breaking heat, some cooling is expected in the Eastern United States starting Thursday.

title: U.S. Textile Makers, Feeling Forgotten by Trump, Hope Boom Days Are Ahead
summary: The Trump administration faces hard choices in determining what industries to protect as it uses tariffs to construct an industrial policy.

title: The Washington Post Will Ask Some Sources to Annotate Its Stories
summary: The program, called From the Source, will start with articles from the publication’s climate team. It could provide readers with more viewpoints but would also require moderation and vetting.

title: Taco Trucks Feed Workers After the Palisades Fire
summary: A huddle of trucks has become the most reliable place for cleanup crews and contractors to find lunch.
